title: Create HuggingFaceModelConfig class with provider-specific parameters
description:
**As a** Consoul developer
**I want** a HuggingFaceModelConfig class for HuggingFace-specific parameters
**So that** users can configure HuggingFace models with proper type validation

**Context:**
HuggingFace models support various configuration parameters through both HuggingFaceEndpoint and HuggingFacePipeline. Research shows these key parameters:
- task: text-generation, text2text-generation, summarization
- max_new_tokens: Maximum tokens to generate
- do_sample: Enable/disable sampling
- repetition_penalty: Penalize repeated tokens
- temperature: Sampling temperature
- top_p, top_k: Nucleus and top-k sampling
- model_kwargs: Additional model-specific parameters

Following the pattern of other provider configs (OpenAIModelConfig, AnthropicModelConfig), create a HuggingFaceModelConfig class.

**Technical Notes:**
- src/consoul/config/models.py - Add after OllamaModelConfig (line 241)
- Extend BaseModelConfig like other provider configs
- Use Literal[Provider.HUGGINGFACE] for provider field
- Include HuggingFace-specific parameters
- Support both endpoint-based and pipeline-based parameters
- Reference: https://docs.langchain.com/oss/python/integrations/chat/huggingface/
- Update ModelConfig union type to include HuggingFaceModelConfig
- Add to __all__ exports

**Acceptance Criteria:**

Given I create a HuggingFaceModelConfig instance
When I set model="meta-llama/Llama-3.1-8B-Instruct"
Then the config validates and sets provider to HUGGINGFACE

Given I configure HuggingFace-specific parameters
When I set task="text-generation", max_new_tokens=512, do_sample=False
Then Pydantic validates all parameters correctly

Given I provide invalid task parameter
When I set task="invalid-task"
Then validation error is raised

Given I check the ModelConfig union type
When I review the type definition
Then HuggingFaceModelConfig is included in the union

**Testing Considerations:**
- Test config instantiation with valid parameters
- Test Pydantic validation for invalid values
- Test serialization/deserialization to YAML
- Test that provider field is correctly typed
- Verify mypy type checking with new config class
- Test model_kwargs for additional parameters

**Implementation Hints:**
```python
class HuggingFaceModelConfig(BaseModelConfig):
    """HuggingFace-specific model configuration."""
    
    provider: Literal[Provider.HUGGINGFACE] = Provider.HUGGINGFACE
    task: Literal[
        "text-generation",
        "text2text-generation", 
        "summarization"
    ] | None = Field(
        default="text-generation",
        description="HuggingFace task type"
    )
    max_new_tokens: int | None = Field(
        default=512,
        gt=0,
        le=4096,
        description="Maximum new tokens to generate"
    )
    do_sample: bool = Field(
        default=True,
        description="Enable sampling (vs greedy decoding)"
    )
    repetition_penalty: float | None = Field(
        default=None,
        ge=1.0,
        le=2.0,
        description="Repetition penalty (1.0 = no penalty)"
    )
    top_p: float | None = Field(
        default=None,
        ge=0.0,
        le=1.0,
        description="Nucleus sampling parameter"
    )
    top_k: int | None = Field(
        default=None,
        gt=0,
        description="Top-k sampling parameter"
    )
    model_kwargs: dict[str, Any] | None = Field(
        default=None,
        description="Additional model-specific kwargs"
    )

# Update union type
ModelConfig = Annotated[
    OpenAIModelConfig 
    | AnthropicModelConfig 
    | GoogleModelConfig 
    | OllamaModelConfig
    | HuggingFaceModelConfig,  # Add this
    Field(discriminator="provider"),
]
```

Files to modify:
- src/consoul/config/models.py (add HuggingFaceModelConfig class)
- tests/config/test_models.py (add tests for new config)

Dependencies: SOUL-121
